TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .
The applicant is the sole founder , owner and editor of the ORG newspaper . The newspaper has been published DATE since DATE at the applicant 's expense and has a circulation of CARDINAL copies .

In DATE the applicant was committed for trial on a charge of public incitement to ethnic , racial and religious hatred through the use of the mass - media ( an offence under LAW ) . The prosecution 's case was that the applicant , through a series of publications in his newspaper , called for the exclusion of NORP from social life , alleged the existence of a causal link between social , economic and political discomfort and the activities of NORP , and portrayed the malignancy of the NORP ethnic group .
The case was tried by the ORG .

At the trial the applicant asserted his innocence , maintaining that the “ PERSON - Fascist leadership of the NORP ” was the source of all evils in GPE . He believed that , in the absence of reliable information , the NORP public could not learn the causes and reasons of its predicament . The aim of the publications in his newspaper had been to “ [ educate ] the NORP and NORP who [ had ] suffered from ORG ideology ” .
On DATE ORG acquitted the applicant , finding that it was not proven that he was the author of the publication . On DATE the ORG quashed the acquittal and remitted the case .
On DATE ORG refused the applicant 's petitions for a new socio - humanitarian and authorship report into his publications .
On DATE the applicant asked ORG to commission a history - social report that would clarify the following questions :
“ CARDINAL . Are the NORP a race ?
CARDINAL . Are the NORP a nation ?
CARDINAL . NORP If the NORP are a nation , from what historical period ?
CARDINAL . Are the NORP in GPE a nation or a NORP diaspora ?
CARDINAL . May the adjective ' national ' or the term ' national dignity ' be used in respect of a member of the NORP diaspora ? ”
On DATE ORG refused the applicant 's request , noting that the answers to those questions had already been obtained by the initial socio - humanitarian report . ORG also noted :

“ In the court 's view , it is a generally accepted fact that members of any nation , nationality or ethnic group have national dignity , which is determined by their national self - consciousness , on the basis of which they identify themselves as members of that ethnic group . ”

On DATE the ORG found the applicant guilty of inciting to racial , national and religious hatred and prohibited him from engaging in journalism , publishing and disseminating in the mass - media for DATE . The finding of guilt was based , in particular , on socio - humanitarian , socio - psychological and linguistic reports and on oral testimony by the experts . The applicant maintained before the court that he could not have incited to national hatred because the NORP did not exist as a race or nation .
The applicant lodged an appeal , reiterating that ORG wrongly considered that the “ NORP nation ” existed .

On DATE ORG upheld the conviction . It struck down the prohibition on journalistic activity because that particular form of penalty had been introduced into LAW after the imputed events , and instead sentenced the applicant to a fine of MONEY ( MONEY ) .
